trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for ExpressRoute adoption | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for ExpressRoute adoption | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This page provides a list of requirements to be met before you can order an Azure ExpressRoute circuit.
trans-unit.target: This page provides a list of requirements to be met before you can order an Azure ExpressRoute circuit.

trans-unit.source: Azure ExpressRoute prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Azure ExpressRoute prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To connect to Microsoft cloud services using ExpressRoute, you’ll need to verify that the following prerequisites have been met.
trans-unit.target: To connect to Microsoft cloud services using ExpressRoute, you’ll need to verify that the following prerequisites have been met.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for connectivity
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for connectivity

trans-unit.source: A valid and active Microsoft Azure account.
trans-unit.target: A valid and active Microsoft Azure account.

trans-unit.source: A relationship with a network service provider (NSP) or an exchange provider (EXP) from the [supported list](expressroute-locations.md) through whom connectivity needs to be facilitated.
trans-unit.target: A relationship with a network service provider (NSP) or an exchange provider (EXP) from the [supported list](expressroute-locations.md) through whom connectivity needs to be facilitated.

trans-unit.source: You must have an existing business relationship with the network service provider or exchange provider.
trans-unit.target: You must have an existing business relationship with the network service provider or exchange provider.

trans-unit.source: You’ll need to make sure that the service you use is compatible with ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: You’ll need to make sure that the service you use is compatible with ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a network service provider and your network service provider is not in the supported list, you can still create a connection to Azure.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a network service provider and your network service provider is not in the supported list, you can still create a connection to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Check with your network provider to see if they are present in any of the Exchange locations appearing in supported list.
trans-unit.target: Check with your network provider to see if they are present in any of the Exchange locations appearing in supported list.

trans-unit.source: Have your network provider extend your network to the Exchange location of choice.
trans-unit.target: Have your network provider extend your network to the Exchange location of choice.

trans-unit.source: Order an ExpressRoute circuit through the Exchange provider to connect to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Order an ExpressRoute circuit through the Exchange provider to connect to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Connectivity to the service provider's infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Connectivity to the service provider's infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: You must meet the criteria for at least one of the following items:
trans-unit.target: You must meet the criteria for at least one of the following items:

trans-unit.source: You are a VPN customer of the network service provider and have at least one on-premises site connected to the network service provider’s VPN infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: You are a VPN customer of the network service provider and have at least one on-premises site connected to the network service provider’s VPN infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Check with your network service provider to see if your VPN service meets the requirements for ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: Check with your network service provider to see if your VPN service meets the requirements for ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: Your infrastructure is co-located in the exchange provider’s datacenter.
trans-unit.target: Your infrastructure is co-located in the exchange provider’s datacenter.

trans-unit.source: You have Ethernet connectivity to the exchange provider’s Ethernet exchange infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: You have Ethernet connectivity to the exchange provider’s Ethernet exchange infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: IP addresses and AS numbers for routing configuration.
trans-unit.target: IP addresses and AS numbers for routing configuration.

trans-unit.source: You can use private AS numbers to connect to an Azure private peering routing domain.
trans-unit.target: You can use private AS numbers to connect to an Azure private peering routing domain.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to do so, it must be > 65000.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to do so, it must be > 65000.

trans-unit.source: For more information about AS numbers, see [Autonomous System (AS) Numbers](http://www.iana.org/assignments/as-numbers/as-numbers.xhtml).
trans-unit.target: For more information about AS numbers, see [Autonomous System (AS) Numbers](http://www.iana.org/assignments/as-numbers/as-numbers.xhtml).

trans-unit.source: IP addresses to configure routes.
trans-unit.target: IP addresses to configure routes.

trans-unit.source: A /28 subnet is required.
trans-unit.target: A /28 subnet is required.

trans-unit.source: This must not overlap with any IP address ranges used in your on-premises or in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This must not overlap with any IP address ranges used in your on-premises or in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You must use your own public AS numbers for configuring BGP sessions with Azure public services.
trans-unit.target: You must use your own public AS numbers for configuring BGP sessions with Azure public services.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For more information about ExpressRoute, see the [ExpressRoute FAQ](expressroute-faqs.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about ExpressRoute, see the [ExpressRoute FAQ](expressroute-faqs.md).

trans-unit.source: For information about how to configure your ExpressRoute connection, see:
trans-unit.target: For information about how to configure your ExpressRoute connection, see:

trans-unit.source: [Configure an ExpressRoute connection through a Network Service Provider](expressroute-configuring-nsps.md).
trans-unit.target: [Configure an ExpressRoute connection through a Network Service Provider](expressroute-configuring-nsps.md).

trans-unit.source: [Configure an ExpressRoute connection through an Exchange Provider](expressroute-configuring-exps.md).
trans-unit.target: [Configure an ExpressRoute connection through an Exchange Provider](expressroute-configuring-exps.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
